resource.description: UTF-8 encoded plain text with byte order mark.
Little Endian UTF-16 encoded plain text.
Big Endian UTF-16 encoded plain text.
A wrongly file claiming to be UTF-8 encoded plain text.
A file containing a non-XML character
A file with an unknown encoding.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-001
test-case.description: Attempts to evaluate the "unparsed-text-lines" function with no arguments.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-002
test-case.description: Attempts to reference the "unparsed-text-lines" function with arity zero.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-003
test-case.description: Attempts to reference the "unparsed-text-lines" function with arity one.

modified.change: Context-dependent functions can now be referenced without error.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-004
test-case.description: Attempts to reference the "unparsed-text-lines" function with arity two.

modified.change: Context-dependent functions can now be referenced without error.

test-case.description: Attempts to reference the "unparsed-text-lines" function with arity three.

test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href is a relative URI, static base is defined.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-035
test-case.description: Test the effect of a call to fn:unparsed-text-lines which need not be evaluated. Since implementations are allowed to dereference the sources in any case, an error is allowed.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-036
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $encoding is invalid.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-037
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding cannot be determined.

modified.change: added alternative error code as per bug 21885

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-038
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is invalid for utf-8.

modified.change: added alternative error code as per bug 21885

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-039
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file which contains non-XML characters.

modified.change: added alternative error code as per bug 21885

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-040
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file which does not contain well-formed XML. A processor is not required to support utf-16.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-041
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid utf-8.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-042
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid utf-8.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-043
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid utf-16.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-044
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid utf-16.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-045
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid iso-8859-1.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-046
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid utf-8.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-047
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid utf-16. A processor is not required to support utf-16.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-048
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file whose encoding is valid iso-8859-1.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-049
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file containing various line endings of the form 0A, x0D, and x0Dx0A.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-050
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file containing various line endings of the form 0A, x0D, and x0Dx0A.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-051
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file containing various line endings of the form 0A, x0D, and x0Dx0A. A processor is not required to support utf-16.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-052
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file containing various line endings of the form 0A, x0D, and x0Dx0A. A processor is not required to support utf-16.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-053
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file containing various line endings of the form 0A, x0D, and x0Dx0A.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-054
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href refers to a file containing various line endings of the form 0A, x0D, and x0Dx0A.

test-case.name: fn-unparsed-text-lines-055
test-case.description: Evaluates the "unparsed-text-lines" function with the argument set as follows: $href is a relative URI, static base URI undefined. Like fn-unparsed-text-lines-023 but $href will not be known during static analysis.
